fields.descriptionShort: Leadership training where participants get an increased opportunity to grow in their personality to cope with the role of group leader, team leader, coordinator, foreman, preparer, planner, etc.
fields.description:
In the leadership training course 'Lead without being a boss,' participants get an increased opportunity to grow in their personality to cope with the role of group leader, team leader, coordinator, foreman, preparer, planner, etc. The training aims for you to be able to grow in your role as a leader. You will gain knowledge and understanding in the areas of personal leadership, group development, and how you can prevent and manage conflicts through your way of communicating.

In order to successfully apply your knowledge in everyday life, you will receive concrete tools and tips to convert your newly acquired knowledge into competence in the best possible way. The days are alternated between lectures, discussions, exercises, and self-reflection to best create a good balance and understanding for both yourself as a leader and your employees.

programContent.title: Personal leadership
programContent.purpose: The aim of the day is for you to gain a better understanding of who you are, both as a person and as a leader. You also get tools to be able to apply in a simple way in your everyday life and your work role.
topics: Learning - How do I learn best? What can I do to transform knowledge into competence?
Self-knowledge - How am I as a person and leader? How do I want to be? What can I do to get where I want?
Your role - is it clear? Are you getting enough support? What challenges are you facing?
Mindset - What is the difference between Growth and Fixed mindset? Which mindset do I have? What influences our mindset?
Values - what values do I have and what values do others have? Are there any values that are right or wrong?
Don't take anything personally - Do I take things personally? How does it make me feel if I do? How does it help me? What can I do to take things less personally?

programContent.title: The group's development
programContent.purpose: Today's organization consists of individuals with different experiences and different backgrounds and cultures. In this section, we focus on group and team development. We create an understanding of how a group develops, as well as how I, as a leader, can respond to the group depending on where it is in development.
topics: The group theory FIRO - what makes groups succeed? What does my group need? What do I do as a leader depending on where my group is?
Situational leadership - how do I adapt my leadership to what my group needs?
Psychological safety - What does psychological safety mean? How can it help us as a group and company to develop? How can I as a leader help create a higher psychological safety in my group?
Feedback - how do I give/take feedback? How do we create an environment where we help each other develop?

programContent.title: Communication, coaching leadership, motivation, and conflict management
programContent.purpose: The day aims to create a better understanding that people are different, perceive things differently and communicate differently. After the end of the day, you have also gained an insight into how you can manage and prevent conflicts.
topics: Communication - What is communication? How do we communicate? How do we absorb what is said?
Coaching leadership - What is coaching leadership? What can it lead to? How can I practice it?
Motivation - What motivates? Can I motivate others? What can I do to be motivated even though I am doing, in my opinion, boring tasks?
Conflict Management - How do I manage conflicts? What can I think about to manage conflicts?

fields.descriptionShort: The training is designed to strengthen the leader's role in the company. The aim of the leadership training is to give the participants basic skills in personal leadership etc.
fields.description: This training is designed to strengthen the leader's role in the company. The aim is to give the participant basic skills in personal leadership, group development, and communication, with effects such as increased efficiency and better collaboration. The trainer keeps the process going, lets the participants highlight their own experiences and possibly problem situations that can arise in the leadership role.

programContent.title: The leadership role - an introduction
programContent.purpose: The training starts with clarifying personal leadership. It is important to clarify the role and task as a leader to create an increased 'we feeling' within the company and the local organization.

programContent.title: Changes and stress
programContent.purpose: Here, the participant gets knowledge and tools to identify the different phases in a change process, what is needed to move forward. The aim is also to understand what can arouse resistance to change, how people react differently, and how stress affects us.
topics: What questions do we need answers to?
How do people react to change?
To motivate and lead in change

programContent.title: Teams and team development
programContent.purpose: Now we take a closer look at the individual in the group, as well as how we behave in groups. Which phases do we need to recognize to adapt our leadership to the situation? Deepening in the coaching leadership.

programContent.title: Communication - to prevent and manage conflicts
programContent.purpose: The participant gains increased insight into different communication styles and gets keys to create a better conversation climate. We also look at how learning and communication are connected. We practice communicating in different ways, in writing, orally, and without words (signals and messages).
topics: Feedback - to give feedback in time
The different phases of the conversation

programContent.title: Work environment - Ethics and Morality
programContent.purpose: We go through what the Work Environment Act says and look a little extra at the organizational and social work environment. What does the new regulation say? We also look at the importance of working with basic values, bringing values to life, and increasing cooperation outside our workplaces. What happens in the brain during social stress, and how do we work on health promotion and prevention?
topics: Overview of the law and regulation AFS 2015:4
Homework; put into practice to report on day 6. Based on the participant's role and situation, we identify a task/case from reality, which must be done and reported on the last day.

programContent.title: Follow-up and summary
programContent.purpose: After a break of 2 weeks, we summarize and tie together the different parts from all occasions. The participant can present their homework, something they have chosen to challenge themselves within. What was the result? What did the participant learn? What will be the next step?
topics: Reporting of the homework you have chosen to complete yourself
The group provides feedback and feed-forward
What have we learned about ourselves and from each other?
Summary of the entire education, joint reflection.

fields.descriptionShort: The training is aimed at those who currently have some form of managerial or leadership responsibility. Being able to lead oneself is the first step on the leadership ladder.
fields.description: The leadership training for managers and leaders is aimed at participants who currently hold some form of managerial or leadership responsibility. Being able to lead oneself is the first step on the leadership ladder and something you should master before taking on the challenge of leading a company or other individuals. Leading oneself increases your understanding of leading others. Besides becoming more present and focused in your leadership, you also become more empathetic towards those you lead. Key elements of the program include clarifying the role of the manager/leader linked to tasks and goals.

programContent.title: Role and Creativity
topics: Having the Right Person in the Right Place

programContent.title: The Difficult Conversation
topics: Behaving Like a Leader in Difficult Situations
Working with Cases on Difficult Conversations

programContent.title: Development Discussions and Recruitment
topics: Ethics and Morality in Employee Discussions
An Annual Cycle of Employee Discussions

programContent.title: Labor Law and Substance Abuse Management
Work Environment and Stress Management
topics: Work Environment and the Manager's Responsibility

programContent.title: Working with Goals and Visions
topics: Setting Goals Individually and for the Group
Ethics and Morality and Understanding One's Own Value System

programContent.title: Economic Relationships and Productivity
topics: Key Ratios such as Liquidity, Solvency, Growth

programContent.title: My Development as a Leader
topics: My Own Attitude; Being Who I Pretend to Be
My Own Clarity as a Leader

fields.shortDescription: In the coaching leadership training, we focus on your leadership skills, where challenges turn into areas for development, and we inspire each other.
fields.description:
Coaching leadership is the pedagogy and approach of the future, we are convinced. This training takes you on a journey that will touch you. You get a unique opportunity to delve into the possibilities of coaching leadership.

Challenge yourself in your view of leadership and your own approach, learn to inspire and motivate your employees. It is exciting to contemplate how one can go further in their business and leadership, even as a person. Can coaching leadership take us further, to new solutions, to new heights?

In the training, we work with experiential pedagogy. Theory is interspersed with practice. As a participant, you have the opportunity to practice, test tools and models, and exchange thoughts and reflections with colleagues from other organizations.

topics: Pedagogical Methods for Self-determination and Self-regulated Learning
Where Am I Today in My Leadership and My Company?
Summary of the Day - What Takeaways Do You Have?
Summary of the Day - What Takeaways Do You Have?
Coaching Leadership and its Barriers and Opportunities
We Summarize and Evaluate the Training
Finally, each participant sets individual and realistic development goals.

fields.descriptionShort: The training is designed to strengthen the leader's role in the company. The goal of the leadership training is to give the participants basic skills in personal leadership etc.
fields.description: This training is designed to strengthen the leader's role in the company. The aim is to give the participant basic skills in personal leadership, group development and communication, with effects such as increased efficiency and better collaboration. The trainer keeps the process going, lets the participants highlight their own experiences and possibly problem situations that can arise in the leadership role.

programContent.title: Electrical safety at work
programContent.purpose: Review of electrical safety, understand the danger of electricity and be able to minimize the risk of electrical accidents. To be able to carry out and participate in the maintenance and care of electrical installations in a safe manner and to fulfill the Work Environment Authority's requirements for knowledge and training.

programContent.title: Electrical theory
programContent.purpose: The participant gains knowledge of basic concepts and simpler formulas such as Ohm's law, series connection, parallel connection and the ability to carry out simpler measurements and connections.

programContent.title: Electrical schedules
programContent.purpose: Here the participants gain knowledge about different electrical schemes and the most common symbols.

programContent.title: Sensors and frequency converters
programContent.purpose: During the day we look at the most common sensors to be able to troubleshoot, replace and make the correct connection. Be able to plug in and change frequency converters and set the most common parameters.

programContent.title: Practical exercises
programContent.purpose: The training ends with being able to practically apply troubleshooting, schematic reading, contactor exercises and frequency converters. We use e.g. electrical safety boards, troubleshooting trainers, engine fault simulator, contactor boards and frequency converters.

fields.descriptionShort: To go through the maintenance regulations in order to be able to carry out and participate in maintenance in a safe way and to meet the requirements of the Swedish Working Environment Agency (AFS 2001:1) for knowledge and training
fields.description: According to the Work Environment Act, everyone who works where there is an electrical hazard must have training and knowledge of the consequences of the hazard and the safety measures that are justified for the work task. In the training, we review the regulations of the Work Environment Act and general advice on electrical safety. We also go through risk management and assessment of electrical safety, safety distances and more. The training is primarily aimed at personnel who work in an environment where there is an electrical hazard.

programContent.title: Electrical safety at work
programContent.purpose: Review of electrical safety, understand the danger of electricity and be able to minimize the risk of electrical accidents. To be able to carry out and participate in the maintenance and care of electrical installations in a safe manner and to fulfill the Work Environment Authority's requirements for knowledge and training.

fields.descriptionShort: The training follows current knowledge and skill requirements according to the Electrical Safety Authority's regulations on authorization as an electrical installer ELSAK-FS 2017:4.
fields.description: This training gives you the theoretical knowledge to apply for Authorization A. The knowledge requirements are regulated in the Electrical Safety Authority's regulations ELSAK-FS 2017:4. The training is aimed at electricians who intend to work as electrical installers for regulatory compliance and for those who intend to carry out their own work.

fields.descriptionShort: Learn to understand and manage both the basics and more advanced functions of Excel.
fields.description: The training aims to increase competence in Excel. This provides increased security and better self-confidence. The training is aimed at all target groups for e.g. economists, HR or project managers.

programContent.title: Basics in Microsoft Excel
topics: Create your own formulas and calculations

fields.shortDescription: This training is aimed at you as a project manager and also project employees who want to be able to use Microsoft Project.
fields.description: In order to effectively run a project, a powerful project planning tool is required that frees up time from the employees who can instead focus on the progress of the project. With Microsoft Project, the participant gets a good tool for planning and following up projects. In the training, you learn to manage resources, activities, and budget. We also go through how you create different types of reports for the project's stakeholders. As a participant, you will gain good knowledge of how MS Project can be used effectively in daily work. The training is primarily aimed at you who are project managers, but also at project administrators and project employees.

programContent.title: Project planning
programContent.purpose: During day 1 create and work on a project from start to finish. During the course of the work, the participants learn to use the program's functions in their place.
topics: Overview of Microsoft Project and basic settings
Break down and structure the work with WBS
Determine key milestones and decision points

fields.shortDescription: The aim of the training is to actively work with and carry out systematic work environment work in one's own organisation. The training aims to work for a good working environment.
fields.description:
A good work environment does not come by itself. In order to prevent accidents and ill health, target-oriented and systematic work environment work is necessary for every company today. Violating the work environment law can be expensive. Our training Better working environment (BAM) is aimed at you who are managers, leaders or safety representatives. During three days, you will get the basics of the most important laws and regulations, knowledge of risk management and insights into what a good working environment means for the individual, the company and society.

The training includes the Swedish Work Environment Agency's new regulations on organizational and social work environment, which include bullying and abusive discrimination. The goal of the training is for you to learn systematic work environment work - to practically investigate, implement and follow up the work environment in your own organization.

programContent.title: Laws and regulations regarding work environment
programContent.purpose: We provide you with basic knowledge of laws, regulations, agreements and regulations. You will learn systematic work environment work (AFS 2001:1), which involves investigating, implementing and following up activities to prevent accidents and ill health. You learn to work with risk assessment, risk management and action plans. Among the regulations is also the new AFS 2015:4, which is about preventing bullying and abusive discrimination.
topics: Background, creation and structure of the Work Environment Act
The role of the Work Environment Agency
Violation of the Work Environment Act - penalty fees
New AFS 2015:4 - Organizational and social work environment
Systematic work environment work (SAM) according to AFS 2001:1

programContent.title: Distribution of responsibilities - managers, leaders and safety representatives
programContent.purpose: Managers and safety representatives have different roles and responsibilities in work environment work and need to cooperate in the best way. It is also important to understand how the change work can affect the individual, the group and the organization.
topics: Reflection on day 1 and feedback on the homework
The preventive work: incident reporting, accident reporting, injuries, etc
Managers and leaders, distribution of tasks
The protection organization. Chief safety officer, safety officer and the safety committee
Lathund for introduction of new employees
The role of occupational health care

programContent.title: More about systematic work environment work - risk management and action plans
programContent.purpose: We show how you can identify and manage positive and negative factors for the work environment. You get tools to carry out preventive and systematic work environment work.
topics: Reflection on day 2 and feedback on the homework
Work-related injuries and incidents: follow-up and reporting
Work adaptation and rehabilitation - early signals

fields.descriptionShort: The goal is more influence over future events so that the unpredictability will interfere less when you lead, administer and develop.
fields.description:
In order to carry out environmental audits, knowledge of ISO 14001:2015, important environmental issues and environmental legislation as well as skills in audit technology is required. In order to carry out quality audits, knowledge of the requirements according to ISO 9001 is required. Quality audits can be carried out in different ways with different orientations, for example system-oriented, process-oriented and product-oriented quality audits.

The goal is more influence over future events and thus that the unpredictable should disturb less when leading, administering and developing the audit tool. The training for you who will become an internal auditor or be responsible for internal audits in the business.

programContent.purpose: Most companies have self-designed processes for how the audits are to be carried out. Own documents and regulations. During the training, we look at the basic requirements and try to connect these to the business's own methodology.

fields.descriptionShort: 22 fully-fed training days give you the basics of quality management and standardized management systems such as ISO. You get broad knowledge in business development and inspiration from successful business leaders.
fields.description:
Are you already a quality and environmental manager at your company - or do you want to be? Train with us and become a certified quality and environmental manager! Our full-fledged program of 22 training days gives you the basics of quality management and standardized management systems such as ISO. At the same time, you gain broad knowledge in business development and inspiration from successful business leaders - knowledge that you can use directly in your work.

The training includes both theory and many practical exercises so that you can effectively work with the work environment, sustainability and safety. After completing the training, you have plenty of tools to lead and support your organization and take responsibility for everything that a quality and environmental manager needs to handle.

programContent.title: Quality and environmental project
programContent.purpose: Throughout the training, you will work on your own project that affects the business you are in. You will receive personal supervision and coaching to be able to translate the theories into practical action. The project work will also help you in your personal development as you are forced to reflect on your own leadership and the tasks you face. On the last day, there is a joint presentation of your and the other participants' individual projects. The moment when you present your own project work can be the proudest moment during the entire education.

programContent.title: The basics of quality and environmental management
programContent.purpose: Understand the background to quality and environmental management. We start a project work that gives you the opportunity to practice what we go through during the training and which can be applied in your organization. The project work is presented at the end of the education.

programContent.title: Taking social responsibility internally and externally
programContent.purpose: Do all employees have a good working environment? Is there any discrimination both internally and externally? Do you produce in other countries? Social responsibility is about companies taking responsibility for how they affect society, from an economic, environmental and social perspective.

programContent.title: Business management, management systems and standards
programContent.purpose: We take a firm grip on the development of international standards (ISO). We go through ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and inform about ISO/TS 16949, ISO 17025/17020, HACCP and OHSAS. During the day, we look at so-called soft values such as relationships, as we do an SDI mapping of the strengths and driving forces of the participants and the group.

programContent.title: Effective teams and work environment
programContent.purpose: During the day, we continue with 'effective teams' with the goal of accepting the differences of individuals, so that everyone's varying experiences, background and culture can become an asset in an organization. We also address the Work Environment Act (AML), the Work Environment Agency's regulations (AFS) and what is meant by systematic work environment work (SAM).

programContent.title: Customer and supplier concepts
programContent.purpose: How can you as a quality and environmental manager integrate the factors of leadership, business and governance? Clarity and the ability to 'translate the deal' are important ingredients. During these days, you get tools to create an efficient structure, clarity and methodology in the organization to make optimal use of all resources. A connection between strategies and goals as well as effective operational management is necessary.

programContent.title: Audit - To plan and implement
programContent.purpose: Auditing in the quality and environmental area is based on ISO 19011:2011. The goal is more influence over future events so that the unpredictability will interfere less when you lead, administer and develop. We carry out an audit in a critical situation within a manufacturing industry where the goal is for you to be able to use the audit tool adapted to the business.

programContent.title: Risk management and process tools
programContent.purpose: We go through risk management and how you can recognize warning signs – and address them in time to create a healthy business. We also look at process tools such as failure effect analysis (FMEA), pre-planned quality assurance (APQP), statistical process control (SPS) and capability.

programContent.title: Lean, improvement work and value flow
programContent.purpose: We go through a flowchart that shows step by step activities that together make up a process. The day is devoted to LEAN, which is about maximizing customer benefit and minimizing waste. Based on Toyota's 14 principles, soundness in action and smartness in management, all organizations can be better in different ways. You get answers to questions such as: What is meant by value flow? How well do flows work in manufacturing? How quickly do we get a customer commitment through? How can the lead time be reduced and the value creation time increased?

programContent.title: Process and environmental goals and shortage costs
programContent.purpose: We review goals, KPIs (key figures) and other metrics as well as the outside world's and our own requirements and objectives. What do laws and regulations mean for business management? We also reflect on questions such as: What does 'Constant improvement' mean? What is the basis for systematically getting better? Better than what? What is meant by shortage cost?

programContent.title: Product responsibility and implementation of business systems
programContent.purpose: What is required to run a business? What is meant by product liability? How do we choose the right business system? We take up the concepts from several aspects and discuss the issues. We cover theoretical cases and encourage you and the other participants to bring your own examples for discussion and suggestions for handling.

programContent.title: Evaluation models and refinement of the project work
programContent.purpose: Among other things, we look at how business systems can support the business. Or do you have to adapt it? Based on the knowledge you have now acquired, you should be able to set up systems and get the various owners of the system (process owners) to understand the benefits themselves. What do the evaluation models say and what views does the certification auditor have? During these days, you also refine your project work.

programContent.title: Reporting of the quality and environmental project
programContent.purpose: The project that started at the beginning of the training is now presented to all the participants as well as invitees from various companies and organizations. It will be a fantastic day with lots of knowledge transfer and time to reflect. This day is planned together with the whole group and will be around two weeks after the end of basic training.

programContent.title: Feedback and reflection
programContent.purpose: Feedback, reflection and exchange of experience takes place during one day approximately six months after the end of the program. We look in the rearview mirror where you and other participants get to tell us about your current situation. We also cover current news in the area of quality and the environment.

programContent.title: Graduation
programContent.purpose: When your project work is approved, you will receive your long-awaited degree certificate and diploma in pleasant forms. These can then be added to your CV and you can in the future title yourself 'Diplomed quality and environmental manager'.

fields.descriptionShort: This is the training for you who feel you would like to speak, but don't really know how and feel comfortable. The training gives you the tools to better manage talent and find your safety zone
fields.description:
Do you feel limited by nervousness and maybe even stage fright when it comes to speaking in front of a group, leading meetings, lecturing or presenting a pitch? Dare to speak is the training for you who feel you would like to speak, but don't really dare. Here you get concrete tools to manage your nervousness and reduce fear. Everyone can learn to manage their nervousness and stop letting it limit their lives.

During the Dare to Speak training, you get to meet others in the same situation, which allows you to grow together. From experience, we know that the group should be kept small in order for us to dare to challenge and overcome our anxiety in the face of what we find unpleasant, therefore we never have more than 12 participants on our training dare to speak.

programContent.purpose: During the training day, theory is interspersed with interactive exercises in an easy and educational way. You meet others in the same situation, which allows you to grow together. This is what we go through during the day:
topics: Gain an understanding of your nervousness and where it comes from
Creating safe spaces: how you prepare to dare
List your fears - refuse to let them control you
Then you will be brave enough to overcome your doubts
What do I lose and what do I gain - put your nervousness into perspective
Rhetorical tools for reducing fear of speaking

fields.descriptionShort: This training is aimed at salespeople and people in sales positions who are either relatively new to their role or, despite experience, want to improve their awareness in and about the sales process.
fields.description: This training is aimed at salespeople and people in sales positions who are either relatively new to their role or, despite experience, wish to increase their awareness in and about the sales process. Having a focus on sales and profitability is a must for companies today. In an increasingly competitive world, proactive and professional sales work is becoming increasingly important. The importance of processing and establishing new customer contacts in a good and efficient manner cannot be overestimated.

programContent.title: The market and the customers
programContent.purpose: It often involves long sales cycles and difficult-to-understand decision-making processes, which can also be very variable in character depending on who the customer is. Systematic selling provides a platform to effectively build long-term sales and profitable business relationships with the right customers. We discuss about e.g. the questions:
topics: Current situation - where do I want to go?
Needs analysis – Find out your customer's needs
What exactly is a key customer?
Consultative selling: the sales process for visiting sales
How you behave in a way that inspires confidence and creates an interest in your presentation
How to deal with resistance during the presentation
The importance of the voice and body language

programContent.title: Sales technique
programContent.purpose: In the role of salesperson, it is important to have an understanding of the importance of good presentation techniques, needs analysis, question methodology and closing techniques.
topics: How to build a structure in your presentation
Question methodology as you ask you get answers
To clarify and simplify the solution for your customer
On Getting a Client to Say Yes - Closing Techniques
To present a solution and conclude

programContent.title: The offer and customer needs
programContent.purpose: That the offer is properly packaged is becoming increasingly important in the battle for customers. Among other things, we look at what it really means to be market-oriented and how we communicate the offer to the customer.
topics: Different personality styles and adaptation of the message
Customer benefit is what the customer buys
Create rewarding relationships with your customer
What you as a seller are responsible for

fields.descriptionShort: Key account management (KAM) means working with strategic sales and key customer processing.
fields.description:
As a Key Account Manager (KAM), you work with the company's most important customers. How can you maintain and develop the key customers and at the same time identify the smaller customers who can develop into large ones? How can you adapt your sales communication as the market changes? Our training gives you the basics of systematic sales, key customer strategy, segmentation, KAM economics, negotiation techniques – and much more.

During the KAM training, you carry out individual project work that connects the theories with the practical work in your everyday life. It gives you the ability to map which customers should be prioritized and how you should process them. You get valuable tools to build long-term and profitable relationships with the right customers.

programContent.title: Traditional sales and KAM sales
programContent.purpose: During the first few days, we look at the role of Key Account Manager/major account manager and discuss, among other things: What does it actually mean to work with KAM? What is the difference between traditional sales and KAM sales?
topics: The role of Key Account Manager and its responsibilities
Sales methodology. How are you and the other participants doing at your companies today?
Complex and consultative sales - what is meant?
To position itself as a key supplier
The KAM process and its development phases

programContent.title: Segmentation, systematic sales and key customer strategy
programContent.purpose: What exactly is a key customer? How should you categorize customers? How do you identify today's and tomorrow's key customers? Successful KAM sales are often about long sales cycles and difficult-to-understand decision-making processes. These can also be very variable in character depending on who the customer is. Systematic selling provides a platform to effectively build long-term sales. The right key customer strategy provides profitable business relationships with the right customers.
topics: To create synergy effects between the marketing department and the sales department

programContent.title: KAM economics and negotiation techniques
programContent.purpose: Keeping track of which customers I should prioritize requires an understanding of financial relationships. It also requires answers to questions such as: How do you set a price? What is the right price? Which key figures do you as a salesperson benefit from in your sales and in a customer relationship?

programContent.title: The offer and customer needs
programContent.purpose: How can you package your company's offering? What does it really mean to be market-oriented? How do you communicate the offer to the customer? We go through, among other things:
topics: To focus on customer needs and customer benefit

programContent.title: Project reporting and closure
programContent.purpose: At the very end of the KAM training, you present your individual project work - and the other participants present theirs. A project work may for example include a customer care plan, key customer analysis or KAM plan. It will be a day with lots of reflections and knowledge transfer. Now you have acquired the ability to map which customers should be prioritized and how to process them. And you have been given the tools to build long-term and profitable relationships with the right customers.

fields.descriptionShort: Everything you need to know about maintenance and everything you need to know to create operational reliability and optimal maintenance economy - you get that with the help of our Diplomad Maintenance Manager training
fields.description:
As a maintenance manager, you lead a team of everyday heroes who strive to increase operational reliability through preventive maintenance measures. Your focus is to create motivation through inspiring and knowledgeable leadership to develop a modern maintenance business through improvement work and a standardized way of working.

After 14 well-planned training days, you will have gained in-depth knowledge of maintenance and operational safety, maintenance economics and standardized working methods, among other things.

programContent.title: Maintenance management
programContent.purpose: In order to raise all participants to the same level within the area, we begin the training by going through the basics regarding maintenance and operational safety.

programContent.title: Leadership and team development
programContent.purpose: As a maintenance manager, you are expected to continuously lead and develop your team. In effective teams, the differences of individuals are accepted. In this way, different experiences, background and culture become an asset.

programContent.title: Preventive maintenance
programContent.purpose: Through a standardized way of working, sustainable and quality-assured routines are created.

programContent.title: Reactive maintenance
programContent.purpose: With the right methods, troubleshooting is faster and it is easier to prevent new errors. In cases where errors do occur, it is important to find and remedy them as soon as possible.

programContent.title: Proactive maintenance
programContent.purpose: We go through the positive effects of properly applied operator maintenance and the opportunities that the maintenance organization has when introducing operator maintenance.

programContent.title: Maintenance support
programContent.purpose: An adapted infrastructure is a prerequisite for effective maintenance. Here you will learn about how you can create order and order in your business.

programContent.title: New acquisition
programContent.purpose: In this block, we go through the prerequisites for a maintenance procurement by first evaluating the life cycle economics of the intended equipment and then choosing the right supplier, concept and technology.

programContent.title: Finale
programContent.purpose: The training for maintenance managers ends with a day filled with rehearsal and coaching based on the group's joint results on the knowledge tests that end each block.

fields.descriptionShort: The training gives the participants knowledge of the function of different valves and being able to read, decipher simpler hydraulic diagrams and connect circuits etc.
fields.description:
The aim of the training is for the participants to learn about the function of different valves and to be able to read and decipher simpler hydraulic diagrams. The training also creates awareness of the risks involved when working with hydraulic machines and how accidents can be avoided.

Participants gain basic knowledge of the structure and function of hydraulic systems and their components. The ability to perform common maintenance operations, commissioning and troubleshooting. The understanding of which operating conditions are required for a hydraulic system with high reliability. Environmental impact of hydraulic fluids and management of emissions. The participants must also be able to connect circuits of the degree of difficulty we worked with during the training.

programContent.title: Theory
topics: Regulation of pressure, power, flow and speed
Hydraulic components, pumps, motors, valves, cylinders, Accumulators, tanks and coolers

programContent.title: Practical
topics: Control and adjustment of maximum pressure with safety valve
Load retention with hydraulic lock or over center valve
Installation of hose coupling and pipe coupling

fields.descriptionShort: After the training, participants must be able to make program changes, as well as debug and test existing STEP-7 programs.
fields.description: After the Siemens S7 training, the participants must be able to perform program changes, troubleshoot and test existing STEP 7 programs. Participants must also know the structure, capacity and function of the systems. The training should provide knowledge to solve minor control tasks

programContent.title: The control system
programContent.purpose: We go through the Siemens Simatic S7 control system and basic troubleshooting methodology using computer-based contactor control. Furthermore, troubleshooting also takes place in circuit diagrams with simulated errors and logical thinking.
topics: Basic troubleshooting methodology using computer based contactor control
Circuit diagram troubleshooting with simulated faults
